meanings.definition: The curved or sloping edge of a column or pilaster.
meanings.sent1: The apophyge of the column added an elegant touch to the building's design.
meanings.sent2: Architects carefully consider the apophyge when designing classical structures.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the apophyge of the pillar, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the graceful curve of an apophyge, bringing warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight illuminated the apophyge, highlighting its beauty and craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: A projecting part of a column or pilaster.
meanings.sent1: The apophyge of the pillar extended outward, creating a sense of depth.
meanings.sent2: Visitors admired the intricate details of the apophyge on the ancient columns.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten tried to climb the apophyge, thinking it was a perfect scratching post.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like the apophyge of a column, standing out and drawing attention.
meanings.sent5: The apophyge served both a decorative and structural purpose in the architecture.
